jQuery

Animate On Scroll

I want to animate things as I scroll down the page

See http://scrollme.nckprsn.com/ for more details

+

For simple animations ScrollMe is a great plugin in that allows you to define animations based on when an element enters the page. To use it we need to place the element we want to animate inside a container with the class of scrollme. On the element that we want to animate we give it a few attributes.

<div class="scrollme">
    <div
    class="animateme"
    data-when="enter"
    data-from="0.5"
    data-to="0"
    data-translatex="-200"
    data-rotatez="90">
          Yup, that's all.
    </div>
</div>

data-when determines when it activates with enter (from when the top of the element enters the screen to when the top leaves the screen), exit(from when the bottom of the element enters the screen to when the top leaves the screen) and span(from when the top of the element enters the screen to when the bottom leaves the screen)

data-from is how far in to the scroll area that it starts from 0(at the very start of the scroll area) to 1(at the very end of the scroll area).

data-to is the same but for the end of the animations. if you have a larger from then to then it will go in reverse.

data-translatex is how far in a direction something will be at the “data-to” point on the x axis(left or right).

data-translatey is how far in a direction something will be at the “data-to” point on the Y axis(up and down).

data-rotatex will spin the element on the x axis(think flip in top and bottom)

data-rotatey will spin the element on the y axis(think flip in left and right)

data-rotatez will spin the element on the y axis(think spin clockwise/counterclockwise)

data-scale will determine the size at the “to” point with 0 being unseen and 2 being twice as big.

You can place as many of these as you want but the effect becomes quite hectic.

click for awsome
